abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Background</jats:title>
                <jats:p>β-Thalassemia is mainly caused by point mutations in the β-globin gene cluster. With the rapid development of sequencing technic, more and more variants are being discovered.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Results</jats:title>
                <jats:p>In this study, we found two novel deletion mutations in two unrelated families, <jats:italic>HBB:</jats:italic> c.180delG (termed β<jats:sup>CD59</jats:sup>) and <jats:italic>HBB:</jats:italic> c.382_402delCAGGCTGCCTATCAGAAAGTG (termed β<jats:sup>CD128-134</jats:sup>) in family A and B, respectively. Both the two novel mutations lead to β-thalassemia trait. However, when compounded with other β<jats:sup>0</jats:sup>-thalassemia, it may behave with β-thalassemia intermedia or β-thalassemia major.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Conclusion</jats:title>
                <jats:p>Our study broadens the variants spectral of β-thalassemia in Chinese population and provides theoretical guidance for the prenatal diagnosis.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec>

group.label: Ethics approval and consent to participate
group.name: EthicsHeading

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: Informed consents were obtained from the probands and their family members. This study was approved by the Medical Ethics Committee of Guangdong Women and Children Hospital. The study was conducted in accordance with the Declaration of Helsinki.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: All patients and their family members approved the publication of the manuscript.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: The authors declared no competing interests.

title: Two novel deletion mutations in β-globin gene cause β-thalassemia trait in two Chinese families
